means: 布洛克，赫伯特·劳伦斯（（生于 1909） 美国卡通片制作者，优秀作品曾见诸<华盛顿邮报> 及遍布全国的200多家报纸。他获得了1942年和1954年的普利策奖）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"阻止，阻塞"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: block, bar, hinder, obstruct, prevent, hamper
means: block ： 语气强烈，指有效堵住了通道，使人或物无法通过。
bar ： 含义与block很接近，指阻塞通道或禁止出入，但有对暗示不用障碍物的阻止或禁止。
hinder ： 语气较轻，多指阻碍、拖延人或事，强调使进展速度缓慢下来。
obstruct ： 正式用词，语气强，多指以干扰或设置障碍的方式阻碍交通，使不能自由畅通。
prevent ： 含义广泛，指采取预防措施或设置障碍去阻止某人或某事。
hamper ： 侧重因受到约束或阻碍而造成的行动困难。

word_mean: 研磨(粗磨、细磨)和抛光过程中，黏结光学零件的模具。
划归一台采掘设备开采的区段。
分块全息存储，block-organized holographic memory
又称 :总段(complete cross section)，按船体建造的工艺需要及船体结构的特征，对主船体沿船长方向进行横向划分所形成的船体环形区段。
墩木，由木材、金属或水泥制成，在船台或船坞修造船舶过程中用以支承船体的长方形柱体。
码块，由于技术或逻辑的原因，可作为一个整体处理，但不一定在时间上相邻的一串连续比特。

sentence.Network_cn: 有人把一大块石头给凿空了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 块设备的最小寻址单元是扇区，内核与块设备交互的最小单元是块(block)，块大小一般是扇区大小的整数倍这个和楼主的问题没有任 …
新概念英语单词大全_百度文库 ... blare vi. 发嘟嘟声 block n. 街区 board vt. 上(车船，飞机).
至于阻塞（block）和非阻塞（non-block）其实描述的是进程或线程进行等待时的一种方式。阻塞的意思是等待时进程或线程需要挂起…
区块(block) ，区块包含一个 "操作码"(opcode) 来指示要执行何种操作，伴随著一些引数(arguments) 提供更多的需求细节。

list.abs: 或齐头式(Block style)，美国常用这种格式；每段的第一个词缩进去，称为缩进式或锯齿式(indented style)，英国常用此格式。
“乳液”用英语怎么说？急用！谢谢_爱问知识人 ... spot（ 青春痘用） sun block（ 防晒用） toning lotion（ 化妆水）.

其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (denoting a log or tree stump): from Old French bloc (noun), bloquer (verb), from Middle Dutch blok, of unknown ultimate origin

entry.def: A block of flats or offices is a large building containing them.

example.tran: 一栋漆成白色的公寓大楼

entry.def: A block in a town is an area of land with streets on all its sides.

example.ex: She walked four blocks down High Street...
example.tran: 她沿着商业大街走了4个街区。

example.ex: He walked around the block three times.
example.tran: 他绕着这个街区转了3圈。

entry.def: A block of a substance is a large rectangular piece of it.
To block a road, channel, or pipe means to put an object across it or in it so that nothing can pass through it or along it.

example.ex: Some students today blocked a highway that cuts through the center of the city...
example.tran: 今天一些学生堵塞了一条贯穿市中心的公路。

example.ex: When the shrimp farm is built it will block the stream...
example.tran: 一旦养虾场建起来，将会截断这条河流。

entry.def: If something blocks your view, it prevents you from seeing something because it is between you and that thing.

example.ex: ...a row of spruce trees that blocked his view of the long north slope of the mountain.
example.tran: 一排云杉挡住了他的视线，使他看不到这座山绵长的北坡

entry.def: If you block someone's way, you prevent them from going somewhere or entering a place by standing in front of them.

example.ex: I started to move round him, but he blocked my way...
example.tran: 我准备绕过他，但他挡住了我。

example.ex: Mr Calder tried to leave the shop but the police officer blocked his path.
example.tran: 考尔德先生想离开商店，但是那位警员拦住了他。

entry.def: If you block something that is being arranged, you prevent it from being done.

example.ex: For years the country has tried to block imports of various cheap foreign products...
example.tran: 多年来，这个国家一直竭力阻挠各种廉价外国产品的进口。

example.ex: His persistent attempts to complain to his superiors were blocked and ignored.
example.tran: 他一再试图向上级投诉，但都被挡了回来并置之不理。

entry.tran: （体育运动中）拦截，阻截（进球、对手等）
entry.def: In some sports, if a player blocks a shot or kick, they stop the ball reaching its target. If one player blocks another, the first stops the second from reaching or moving with the ball.

example.ex: In the final seconds, Gunn goalie Kevin Cantwell blocked two shots.
example.tran: 在最后的几秒钟，甘恩队的守门员凯文·坎特维尔扑出了两次射门。

entry.tran: （尤指按特定顺序同时售出的）大量，大批，大套（票、股票等）
entry.def: A block of something such as tickets or shares is a large quantity of them, especially when they are all sold at the same time and are in a particular sequence or order.

example.ex: Those booking a block of seats get them at reduced rates.
example.tran: 团体订座可享受折扣价。

entry.tran: （短时间的）思维停滞，思维中断
entry.def: If you have a mental block or a block, you are temporarily unable to do something that you can normally do which involves using, thinking about, or remembering something.

entry.tran: 冒着败坏名声的风险；拿名誉（或地位）做赌注
entry.def: If someone lays their head on the block, or puts their head on the block, they are risking their reputation or position by taking a particular course of action.

example.ex: The Chancellor, by his unusual statement, has put his head on the block.
example.tran: 这位总理冒着丢乌纱帽的风险发表了一份非同寻常的声明。

means.word_mean: 1. a solid piece of something (usually having flat rectangular sides);

sentences.sentence: "the pyramids were built with large stone blocks"

means.word_mean: 2. a rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings;
3. a three-dimensional shape with six square or rectangular sides
4. a number or quantity of related things dealt with as a unit;

sentences.sentence: "he reserved a large block of seats"
"he held a large block of the company's stock"

means.word_mean: 5. housing in a large building that is divided into separate units;

sentences.sentence: "there is a block of classrooms in the west wing"

means.word_mean: 6. (computer science) a sector or group of sectors that function as the smallest data unit permitted;

sentences.sentence: "since blocks are often defined as a single sector, the terms `block' and `sector' are sometimes used interchangeably"

means.word_mean: 7. an inability to remember or think of something you normally can do; often caused by emotional tension;

sentences.sentence: "I knew his name perfectly well but I had a temporary block"

means.word_mean: 8. a simple machine consisting of a wheel with a groove in which a rope can run to change the direction or point of application of a force applied to the rope
9. a metal casting containing the cylinders and cooling ducts of an engine;

sentences.sentence: "the engine had to be replaced because the block was cracked"

means.word_mean: 10. an obstruction in a pipe or tube;

sentences.sentence: "we had to call a plumber to clear out the blockage in the drainpipe"

means.word_mean: 11. a platform from which an auctioneer sells;

sentences.sentence: "they put their paintings on the block"

means.word_mean: 12. (American football) the act of obstructing someone's path with your body;

sentences.sentence: "he threw a rolling block into the line backer"

means.word_mean: 1. render unsuitable for passage;
2. hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of;

sentences.sentence: "His brother blocked him at every turn"

means.word_mean: 3. stop from happening or developing;
4. interfere with or prevent the reception of signals;

sentences.sentence: "block the signals emitted by this station"

means.word_mean: 5. run on a block system;
6. interrupt the normal function of by means of anesthesia;
7. shut out from view or get in the way so as to hide from sight;

sentences.sentence: "The thick curtain blocked the action on the stage"
"The trees obstruct my view of the mountains"

means.word_mean: 8. stamp or emboss a title or design on a book with a block;
9. obstruct;
10. block passage through;
11. support, secure, or raise with a block;
12. impede the movement of (an opponent or a ball);
13. be unable to remember;

sentences.sentence: "You are blocking the name of your first wife!"

means.word_mean: 14. shape by using a block;
15. shape into a block or blocks;

sentences.sentence: "block the graphs so one can see the results clearly"

means.word_mean: 16. prohibit the conversion or use of (assets);

sentences.sentence: "Freeze the assets of this hostile government"

example.en: That block of yours is pretty dense.
example.zh: 你那个脑袋瓜真是愚蠢透顶。

example.en: Wally acts like such a block!

Sentence.sentence: But inside, special windows cut power bills by blocking solar heat in summer and retaining indoor warmth in winter.

The next block was almost empty.

The city is the building block of civilisation and of almost everything people do; a guidebook to the city is really, therefore, a guidebook to how a large and ever-growing chunk of humanity chooses to live.
Hello, my bathroom drain is blocked and I'm giving a party tonight.
